title: Jonathan Kaplan's referee's view: Tomas Lavanini red card inevitable and perfect example of when TMO system works
text:
The decision to show Tomas Lavanini a red card for his hit on Owen Farrell was unquestionably correct and was also the perfect example of how the relationship between a referee and TMO should work.

Nigel Owens did not realise on first viewing how bad the tackle was, saying he had seen no foul play. I can understand that - it is often very difficult in real time to see exactly how dangerous a tackle is. A referee often only partially sees it and that is why we have the TMO system in place, to ensure that nothing slips through.

TMO Marius Jonker clearly felt the tackle deserved a second viewing and told Nigel to take another look at the next break in play. From that moment on it was up to Nigel...
